intro: Anemone hofengensis, commonly known as the Hofeng anemone, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has finely divided, palmate leaves. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections. Anemone hofengensis is also noted for its ability to thrive in cooler climates and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
